intro: Lasiocephalus otophorus var. christophori, commonly known as the Christofori's haircap, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is a perennial herb with dense, tufted growth and features slender, cylindrical stems covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in wetland habitats.
